cyclone.name: HANNA
cyclone.current_location: about 405 mi ESE of Port O'Connor, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: continuing west-northwest across the north-western Gulf, aiming for the central-to-southern Texas coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Texas coast between Port O'Connor and Corpus Christi

weather_observation.watch_coast: Port Mansfield to High Island, Texas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Texas coast from Port Mansfield northward to High Island, including Corpus Christi and the Coastal Bend
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39-57 mph) possible late Friday into Saturday with gusts around 50 mph.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal flooding and a surge of roughly 1–3 ft possible in Corpus Christi Bay and adjacent barrier-island inlets.
weather_observation.rainfall: Widespread 3–5 inches with isolated totals up to 8 inches could fall across the Coastal Bend, producing flash-flood potential.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents beginning Friday.
